id.description: Alpha numeric ID that will be unique for archiving.
id.title: id

datum.description: Datum of latitude and longitude coordinates. Should be a well-known datum, such as WGS84, and will be the reference datum for all locations.  This is important for the user, they need to make sure all coordinates in the survey and child items (i.e. stations, channels) are referenced to this datum.
datum.title: datum

geographic_name.description: Closest geographic reference to survey, usually a city but could be a landmark or some other common geographic reference point.
geographic_name.title: geographic_name

project.description: Alpha numeric name for the project e.g USGS-GEOMAG.
project.title: project

summary.description: Summary paragraph of survey including the purpose; difficulties; data quality; summary of outcomes if the data have been processed and modeled.
summary.title: summary
summary.examples: long project of characterizing mineral resources in Yukon

time_period.end_date.description: End date of the survey in UTC.
time_period.end_date.title: time_period.end_date

time_period.start_date.description: Start date of the survey in UTC.
time_period.start_date.title: time_period.start_date
